conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
<reason> As an opening proposal, I want to start by setting a price slightly above my production costs to ensure a profit and to leave room for negotiation. I will propose a price that is higher than my costs but not too excessive, so the negotiation can start on reasonable grounds. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I have a high-quality object X for sale. I understand you're in the market to buy resources. I've invested 40 ZUP into producing this object and I'm looking for a fair trade. I propose giving you 1 unit of X for 50 ZUP. This price includes my costs and a reasonable profit margin. Looking forward to your counteroffer. </message>

<other player message> Hello Player RED, I appreciate your offer and the quality of the object X. I recognize the value of your work and the need for a fair profit. I hope this is a starting point for our negotiation. </other player message>

I will propose a slightly higher amount to meet in the middle, which should be acceptable to both parties while allowing me to secure a better profit. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your considerate offer of 45 ZUP, Player BLUE. I'm glad we're on the same page regarding the value of object X. To come to a fair agreement for both of us, I propose a slight adjustment. How about I give you the object X for 48 ZUP? This ensures I make a reasonable profit for the quality and effort put into producing the object while still being a good deal for you. Let's make this trade beneficial for both sides. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your willingness to find a middle ground, Player RED. I believe we're close to a fair deal for both of us. As a gesture towards finalizing our negotiation, I propose giving you 46 ZUP for the object X. This offer is a balance between your initial asking price and my counter, reflecting our mutual interest in a beneficial trade. I hope this meets your expectations for a reasonable profit. </other player message>

<reason> Player BLUE's new offer of 46 ZUP is a compromise between our previous proposals. It offers a modest profit margin that is acceptable, considering the negotiation process. While it's slightly below my last proposal, it's still above my production cost, so accepting this offer would fulfill my goal of selling for a profit. Since we are both interested in a fair trade and this might be a reasonable point to conclude the negotiations positively, I'm inclined to accept this offer. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your revised offer, Player BLUE. I agree that 46 ZUP is a fair price that reflects the value of object X and provides a reasonable profit for the effort put into its production. I'm pleased we could come to an agreement that benefits both of us. I accept your offer. Let's proceed with the trade. </message>
